meanings.definition: To remove a nail or nails from (something)
meanings.sent1: I will unnail the picture frame from the wall.
meanings.sent2: He carefully unnails the loose board from the floor.
meanings.sent3: The carpenter had to unnail the mistake he made in the woodwork.
meanings.sent4: She had to unnail her beliefs about perfection to embrace imperfection.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the hammer unnailing the old wood echoed through the room.

meanings.definition: To release or free from being nailed
meanings.sent1: The locksmith had to unnail the door to rescue the trapped cat.
meanings.sent2: The hero unnails the captive princess from the dungeon wall.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to unnail the volunteer from the wooden box unharmed.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter unnails the tension in the room, bringing smiles to everyone's faces.
meanings.sent5: The key to happiness is to unnail yourself from the past and live in the present.

meanings.definition: To undo or reverse the action of nailing
meanings.sent1: The artist had to unnail the canvas to make corrections to the painting.
meanings.sent2: He quickly unnails the sign from the tree before the storm hits.
meanings.sent3: The prankster decided to unnail the chair to play a joke on his friend.
meanings.sent4: Her words unnail the doubts in his mind, giving him confidence to move forward.
meanings.sent5: The decision to unnail the relationship was difficult, but necessary for their happiness.
